Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian black-figured Sphinx and Lion Style pottery dinos; interior reserved; exterior, white slip: bands on edges of rim, on top double guilloche pattern with added red dots between dilute bands; on bowl, short vertical strokes between bands above black-figure decoration consisting of parts of two lions to right (on left, front of head with red blob on forehead; on right, tail of second lion); part of incised pendant and full rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos places this sherd in Group C of the Sphinx and Lion Style. The vases in this group may all have been decorated by the same painter. The cogwheel rosettes have more spikes and the figures are well executed. The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as Boston 86.530.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 145, p. 148, p. 318, no. 1402)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0035) (phase 2)
